summary:
Through my studies and experience in environmental science and sustainable development, I have a deep understanding of the climate and ecological crisis and its relationship to human systems.

I am passionate about combining environmental science with technical models and tools to make a concrete positive impact; for example, I worked on integrating climate risk into existing financial tools and developed a new methodology to assess the impact of land use on ecosystem services.

Over time, I have worked with a wide variety of people in different cultural settings: from financial sector clients, academics, technical modellers and designers to military representatives, refugee camp residents, activists, volunteers and outdoor enthusiasts.

Aaron Pereira and I worked together on climate action and refugee/migrant justice projects, discovering our shared vision and forming a strong team. We decided to form Solid Sustainability Research, where we employ our analytical, technical, social and creative skills in projects that we feel society needs.

www.solid-sustainability.org

Solid Sustainability conducts independent research and communicates complex ideas that we care about.

Our concrete activities include: research; data analysis; development of web apps and websites; data visualisation; science communication; leading workshops and facilitating discussions; coordinating projects, coalitions and decentralised research.

awards.title: Winner of the Rachel Carson Environmental Thesis Prize
awards.description:
With the Rachel Carson prize, the VVM wants to give greater publicity to environmental and sustainability research that students have carried out. The jury members come from the environmental work field, universities and higher education.

https://www.vvm.info/milieuscriptieprijs

awards.title: Participant in the honours programme Young Leaders League
awards.description:
The YLL Honours programme (now named Young Innovators) is a selective 15 EC honours course at the graduate level, to be taken on top of any Master's programme. The programme embodies a community of learning, where the focus is on creating positive impact through social innovation and personal leadership. As such, the programme focuses on learning to research, design and deliver innovative and sustainable solutions to real-life societal challenges. 

The programme included:
-seminars on sustainability, globalization, entrepeneurship and ethics
-masterclasses by prominent persons from NGOs, government or business, 
-workshops on personal development and group work

Specific projects I work on in a multidisciplinary team:
-project for Oxfam Novib, about the possibilities of implementing a new Impact Measurement method
-project for ChristenUnie, writing a vison on the Dutch energy transition

https://www.uu.nl/masters/en/general-information/international-students/about-utrecht-university/young-innovators/about-young

profile_positions.description:
Solid Sustainability conducts independent research and communicates ideas that we care about.

We are two passionate researchers with extensive experience in environmental science, finance, artificial intelligence, software development and science communication. We use these skills to provide insight into various aspects of the climate and ecological crises, always firmly based on the facts.

www.solid-sustainability.org
profile_positions.title: Mede-oprichter

profile_positions.description:
With Circle Economy, I worked on mapping the current state of financial flows toward circular building, what the barriers are, and how to overcome these. I contributed to the research together with colleagues from WBCSD and Metabolic and was responsible for editing the Finance chapter as a whole (1 of the chapters of the full report). 

This work is a part of the 'Circular Buildings Coalition' (CBC), a new group of European leaders in sustainability and circular economy in the built environment - an initiative of the Laudes Foundation. CBC Partners: Ellen Macarthur Foundation, World Green Building Council, WBCSD, Metabolic, Circle Economy

https://www.circularbuildingscoalition.org/
profile_positions.title: Freelance Researcher for Circular Building Coalition (Financing of Circular Buildings)

profile_positions.description:
The European Union (EU) Contest for Young Scientists (EUCYS) is the most important student science fair in the EU, showcasing the best of student scientific achievement in the EU and beyond. Each year, the event brings together promising, talented students & bright young minds (14-20 years old) from all over Europe and beyond, to present their projects to a panel of international judges.  

My main responsibility was volunteer coordination (24 international volunteers and 22 local volunteers). Besides that, I supported with communication with contestants and National Organisers, and other organisational tasks such as travel arrangements.

https://eucysleiden2022.eu
profile_positions.title: Volunteer Coordinator & Project Support - EU Contest for Young Scientists (EUCYS) 2022

profile_positions.description:
In 2022, the first edition of the EU TalentOn took place. During this brand-new European event, 104 highly ambitious and motivated early career researchers from across the EU work on innovative solutions to challenges within five Mission Arenas, linked to the EU Missions. These range from combatting cancer, to climate adaptation, smart cities, healthy waters, and healthy soil. The program combines academic and entrepreneurial skills, and the teams of 4 are given only a few days to follow a program that leads them to eventually pitch their ideas to a jury. 

My main responsibility was finding experts to support the event in the form of presenting a mini-lecture or being available on call to answer questions from the participants. I also coordinated volunteer tasks and supported with communications with participants and other organisational tasks such as travel arrangements.

https://talenton.eu
profile_positions.title: Volunteer Coordinator & Program Support - EU TalentOn 2022

profile_positions.description:
Within the Climate & ESG Solutions team, I ensured that our products were of the highest possible quality, based on latest scientific insights and addressed our clients' needs. I coordinated our collaborations with partners and academics and was responsible for the climate science and sustainability-related content of our work.

Climate & ESG Solutions at Ortec Finance specializes in integrating sustainability across their clients’ strategic investment decision-making process. This enables clients to understand their sustainability risks and opportunities, act on their values and meet regulatory requirements – all through efficient integrated software solutions. Ortec Finance combines research-backed ESG and climate change insights with traditional investment process modeling and analysis.

https://www.ortecfinance.com/climate
profile_positions.title: Climate & Sustainability Expert - Integration in Financial Tools

profile_positions.description:
Together with my good friend Wouter, I founded Thesis Service Leiden. We bundle our expertise to help students write great theses.

www.thesisserviceleiden.nl
profile_positions.title: Oprichter

profile_positions.description:
I worked as a freelance consultant for Terra Consulting, supporting in writing proposals, for example a proposal for receiving climate adaptation funding for a German medium sized company. 

Terra Consulting delivers innovative environmental solutions/advice for public and private sector clients who want to contribute towards greater sustainability.

www.terra-consulting.eu
profile_positions.title: Sustainability Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Everyday, just a smile is a small volunteer association directed at supporting people in need. We have been active for almost a year in Derveni-Alexyl refugee camp in the Thessaloniki area, Greece. I have spent more than 6 months working in this camp and other camps in Northern Greece.

We cooperated with the other organizations on site (IOM, UNHCR, Terre des Hommes/Arsis, Caritas, MSF) and filled the gaps that were left by the army and the big organizations. Our main activities were distributing clothes, shoes and other basic neccessities, running a sowing and knitting project, creating a sports area and "playstation room". We have also provided kettles, hot plates for people to cook and coffee, tea and sugar, organized dinner parties with the community and refered people to services in the city. 

Most importantly, we work together with camp residents as colleagues and are there for them as friends. Everyone deserves to smile at least once a day :)

Remotely, I have stayed in contact with (former) camp residents and other volunteer groups, collecting and relaying information and helping people with building their new life (incl. practising the language). I have organized information and fundraising events, as well as a meet-up between Syrians and Dutch people. In addition, I have been in contact with several journalists and migration researchers and contributed to articles about the situation for refugees in different European countries, in specific Derveni camp and (Northern) Greece. 

https://www.voanews.com/a/closure-of-greek-camps/4093463.html

www.facebook.com/everydayjustasmile
profile_positions.title: Field Coordinator (supporting refugees)

profile_positions.description:
Trinomics B.V. is an economic policy consultancy carrying out research and delivering policy advice related to energy, environment and climate change. Clients are international, European and national public sector bodies and NGOs. 

At Trinomics I worked on two projects for the European Commission, related to the design of a European network of Green Infrastructure and the evaluation of the Climate Adaptation Strategy. 

www.trinomics.eu
profile_positions.title: Traineeship

profile_positions.description:
Stichting Kinderpostzegels Nederland is a Dutch foundation with the aim of supporting vulnerable children, since 1924. The department Service & Information deals with the yearly 'Kinderpostzegelactie', during which Dutch kids sell stamps, cards and other products to raise money ("by kids, for kids"). 

My main activities with SKN include resolving occuring problems and responding to e-mails, telephone and mail. In general: making sure everything runs smoothly, supporting the schools during the action and making sure customers are satisfied - with the ultimate goal of maximum proceeds that are used to support vulnerable kids in the Netherlands and abroad.

www.kinderpostzegels.nl
profile_positions.title: Employee Department Service and Information

profile_positions.title: Snowboard instructor, shop attendant, skischool booking office and ski/snowboard rental

volunteer_experiences.description:
As an independent volunteer I have worked within various projects, but I was mainly occupied with coordinating a tea tent and working within the Hummus Rights Project. 

Besides the actual work, even more important was meeting the people there, making new friends, learning about their stories, culture and language and having a good time within this terrible situation. 

With the Hummus Rights Project I helped with the preparation and distribution of food. At the distribution I would make sure people/kids would not cut in line and the line would stay orderly. I also drove the van, which was quite challenging sometimes when I would have to park it within the mass of people waiting for the food and when we would have to quickly load it and get away in emergency situations. 

Soon after I arrived in Greece I took over the chai tent from the previous coordinator. My main tasks were to buy supplies and drive all the equipment to camp, communication with other coordinators and with volunteers for the chai tent. There was a great team of refugee volunteers who would set up, make the tea and fill the cups.

Shortly before Eidomeni got evicted, I moved the chai tent to one of the new military camps around Thessaloniki (Sindos). I had to start over and find a new team of refugee volunteers. During the first days I made the chai myself and explained to the new team how everything worked. After 10 days I could hand over the chai tent to a new coordinator within Swisscross.help, the organization that is active in Sindos. 

During the days I was in Sindos, I helped the Swisscross with cleaning and playing with the kids. During my time in Eidomeni I spent some time helping other projects, such as putting tarps over leaking tents and collecting usable tents after the eviction of Eidomeni, and I sometimes helped prepare food with a Greek organization.

volunteer_experiences.role: Coordination of volunteers, responsible for email contact with volunteers
volunteer_experiences.description:
http://www.hulpkaravaangriekenland.nl/

"Hulpkaravaan naar Griekenland" started from the initiative of Erika Mauritz. In the middle of the refugee crisis she observed that Greece was not able to provide proper care for refugees and that other EU countries did not provide help either. That is why regular citizens have to step up and help. 

All over Holland goods such as tents, blankets, shoes, clothes, personal care products and food were collected and brought to the main location in Bleiswijk. There everything was sorted and packed, ready for transport to Greece. 

I helped with these activities in Delft and Bleiswijk and functioned as a coordinator: answering emails from volunteers and being in the warehouse in Bleiswijk approximately 3 times a week.

Since december I live in Switzerland and still send out a newsletter to the volunteers every week and answer emails. I also helped with setting up the crowdfunding page (http://gofundme.com/aidcaravan).

www.facebook.com/everydayjustasmile

Everyday, just a smile is a small volunteer association directed at supporting people in need. Currently we are active in Derveni-Liti-Alexil refugee camp in the Thessaloniki area, Greece. 

We cooperated with the other organizations on site (IOM, UNHCR, Terre des Hommes/Arsis, MSF) and filled the gaps that were left my the army and the big organizations. Our main activities were distributing warm winter clothes and other means to stay warm and running a sowing and knitting project. We have also prodived hot plates for people to cook and coffee, tea and sugar.

I am part of the working group of "Het Groene Ideecafé" (in English: Green Idea Café). Het Groene Ideecafe is a platform for local sustainability initiatives. Every month we organize an evening around a sustainability theme where we host speakers or interactive sessions. Currently we link local initiatives to the Sustainable Development Goals.
